content.value_statement: This skill provides setup instructions for the NEXLY RN project, including guidance on adding shadcn UI components to your development workflow.
actual_capabilities: Provide setup instructions for the NEXLY RN project
Guide users on adding shadcn UI components
Help new contributors get started with the project
limitations: Contains only basic setup documentation, not a comprehensive guide
Limited to the specific project context of NEXLY RN

use_cases.title: New Developer Onboarding
use_cases.description: New team members use this skill to quickly understand how to set up their development environment and add shadcn UI components to the NEXLY RN project.

use_cases.title: Component Installation Reference
use_cases.description: Developers reference the setup instructions when they need to add new shadcn components to their feature implementation.

use_cases.title: Documentation Quick Reference
use_cases.description: Project maintainers use this as a quick reference to verify setup steps are correct and components are documented properly.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Setup Inquiry
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the setup instructions for this project?
prompt_templates.scenario: New user wants to understand how to set up the project

prompt_templates.title: Adding Components
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I add a shadcn UI component to this project?
prompt_templates.scenario: User needs to install a specific component

prompt_templates.title: Development Getting Started
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me get started with development on this project. What do I need to set up first?
prompt_templates.scenario: Developer beginning work on the project

prompt_templates.title: Component Reference
prompt_templates.prompt: What shadcn components are available and how do I add them?

output_examples.input: How do I set up this project?
output: To add shadcn UI components, use the following command:
Replace <component> with the name of the component you want to add.

best_practices: Run npx shadcn@latest add <component> to install new components
Review component documentation before adding to ensure it fits your needs
Use version control to track component additions and changes
anti_patterns: Manually copying component code instead of using the CLI
Skipping the setup steps and assuming components work out of the box
Adding components without reviewing their dependencies first

faq.question: What is this skill for?
faq.answer: This skill provides setup instructions for the NEXLY RN project, specifically for adding shadcn UI components to your development environment.

faq.question: How do I add a new shadcn component?
faq.answer: Run npx shadcn@latest add <component> where <component> is the name of the component you want to install.

faq.question: Does this skill execute commands?
faq.answer: No, this skill only provides documentation and guidance. You must run commands yourself in your terminal.

faq.question: What is shadcn UI?
faq.answer: shadcn/ui is a collection of re-usable components built with Radix UI and Tailwind CSS that you can copy and paste into your projects.

faq.question: Can I use this for other projects?
faq.answer: This skill is specific to the NEXLY RN project structure. For other projects, you may need different setup instructions.

faq.question: Where can I find component documentation?
faq.answer: Component documentation is available in the project and on the official shadcn website. Check the project README for more details.
